c74object.name: voice-alligator-looper
c74object.description:
This mtr based Note Looper will remember the exact pitches and portamento / glide settings of a musical sequence that was played using voice-alligator.
After recording, it will start playback automatically and play the loops on the set stream (argument 1) to voice-alligator (for a detailed description of streams, see the helpfile of voice-alligator).
If the note looper is set to a higher stream than an input going into voice-alligator, it will by default not steal notes from that input.
voice-alligator also recognizes pre-recorded notes, gives them a special flag, and will output that information to the voice, so that we can customize our voice patch to ignore the pitch-wheel for recorded sequences / the Note Looper for example.

inlet.digest: gets data from voice-alligator, sets methods

inlet.description: auxilary input for parameter recording, The parameters that are recorded here will get the stream number prepended

outlet.digest: sends recorded data back to voice-alligator
outlet.description: sends recorded data back to voice-alligator and append a stream number and a recorded frequency
sends recorded parameter data back out and prepends the stream number

objarg.name: stream
objarg.description:
sets which stream the looper will output to
default 2

method.name: record
method.description: record 1 / 0: starts or stops recording. if notes where recorded, go into play mode

attribute.name: speed
attribute.digest: sets the playback speed as ratio (default 1.)
attribute.description:
sets the playback speed as ratio
default 1.

attribute.name: recordPressed
attribute.digest: transform pressed notes into note-ons on record start
attribute.description:
if a note was pressed when record is set to 1, this decides if the note will be transformed into a note-on on loop start. this makes timing a loop easier.
default true

attribute.name: vol
attribute.description:
multiplies recorded velocities by given percentage
default 100.

attribute.name: volJitter
attribute.digest: volume jitter of ouput as percentage
attribute.description: manipulates recorded velocities by substracting given percentage from them

attribute.name: pitchJitter
attribute.digest: pitch jitter of output as semitones
attribute.description: transposes the recorded notes randomly by given number (in positive and negative direction)
